title: FIIA welcomes invitations to public events
content:
To mark the Finnish Institute of International Affairs’ 65th anniversary, FIIA researchers will be taking part in public events across Finland to discuss the most important current issues in foreign and security policy.

We welcome invitations to a wide range of events and venues where a discussion on foreign policy would be a good fit for the programme.

FIIA offers top-level expertise across many fields of international politics, including Finnish foreign and security policy, Russia, the EU, transatlantic relations, European defence, climate policy and NATO. We are also happy to consider other topic suggestions.

If you know of an event or venue where a discussion on foreign policy would be of interest, please let us know by emailing events@fiia.fi</
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: Study: Russia’s influence activities exploited special characteristics of bilateral relationship with Finland
content:
A study carried out by the Finnish Institute of International Affairs together with the University of Helsinki and the University of Tampere examined Russia’s full-spectrum influence activities directed at Finland since the 2000s and their effects on Finnish society and decision-making.

The government-funded research project is based on the Government Programme and a description of information needs published by the Government.

According to the study, Russia’s influence activities have capitalised on specific characteristics of the bilateral re
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: FIIA introduces programme period 2026–28
content:
The new three-year research programme period of the Finnish Institute of International Affairs has begun on 1 January 2026, also marking the start of FIIA’s 65th anniversary year.

The four research programmes of the previous programme period will continue their work, with some changes in their names and some new thematic emphases. The programmes are:

  • Finland and Northern European Security
  • European Union and Strategic Competition
  • Russia, Eastern Europe and Eurasia
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: President of the Republic of Finland awards Juha Jokela the honour of Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland
content:
President of the Republic of Finland Alexander Stubb has decided to award Juha Jokela, Programme Director at FIIA, the honour of Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland. Jokela directs The European Union and Strategic Competition research programme.

Each year on Finland’s independent day, the decorations of the Orders of the White Rose of Finland are conferred upon citizens who have demonstrated exceptional merit in their professional field or in notable societal roles.
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: Timo R. Stewart named 2026 Social Scientist of the Year
content:
The Social Science Professionals (YKA) has chosen Timo R. Stewart, Senior Research Fellow at FIIA, as the 2026 Social Scientist of the Year.

Stewart has sparked broad public discussion on the situation in the Middle East and has brought academic analysis into that discussion in a remarkable way, YKA states. Stewart has appeared in the media to provide background on the Middle East conflict, and he has also addressed the topic in his book Palestiina ja Israel – historia karttoina (2025), among other works.

YKA’s board awards the honorary mention each year to a person or collective who has commendably represented graduates, students, and professionals in social sciences.
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: Timo R. Stewart named Academic of the Year
content:
The Union of Research Professionals has awarded the Academic of the Year recognition to Timo R. Stewart, Senior Research Fellow at the Finnish Institute of International Affairs. One of Stewart’s noted merits is his ability to clearly present research-based knowledge in public discussions concerning a socially and politically challenging conflict.

The award is given annually to an academic who has advanced the prerequisites for research work and the use of scientific knowledge as part of societal decision-making or brought positive publicity to research and academia.
creator: Meeri Väätäinen
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: FIIA will take part in the 2025 Europe Forum
content:
Photo: Jaska Poikonen / 2024 Euroope Forum

The eighth annual Europe Forum will be held in Turku from August 27 to 29. The forum will celebrate the 30th anniversary of Finland’s EU membership. Themes of the 2025 Europe Forum include changes in the security policy environment, European competitiveness and the EU’s multiannual financial framework.

FIIA will participate in the Europe Forum in three different panels. The Europe Forum is open to everyone and free of charge. You can attend on-site or follow the program live online. All panels can be followed either in person in
creator: Anna Majuri
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: Kultaranta Talks 2025 begin on 16 June with the theme “The Changing World Order”
content:
Kultaranta Talks hosted and organized by the President of the Republic of Finland in cooperation with Finnish Institute of International Affairs will begin next Monday, 16 June. Below is press release 38/2025 from the Office of the President of the Republic of Finland.

President of the Republic of Finland Alexander Stubb will host the Kultaranta Talks 2025 on 16–17 June at the presidential summer residence in Naantali. The theme of this year’s discussions on foreign and security policy is The Changing World Order – Old Meets New.

The two-day event will begin with an international day examining current shifts in the world order. On the first day, the discussions will be moderated by journalists Fareed Zakaria and Francine Lacqua. The second day will focu
creator: Anna Majuri
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: HSF 2025 asks ‘The Hour of Europe’: Can the old continent chart a new course for its future?
content:
When Transatlantic trust frays and old certainties are questioned, can Europe shoulder a larger share of its own defence and a chart a new course for its future success? Under the theme ‘The Hour of Europe’, Helsinki Security Forum 2025 brings experts and decision-makers together to ponder the hard questions and explore Europe’s path forward.

The fourth annual Helsinki Security Forum (HSF) will be held on 19–21 September 2025 in Helsinki, Finland. HSF offers a unique platform for security and defence dialogue at a time when Europe’s ability to act is once again tested.

The global environment continues to face rapid and disruptive changes. Alliances are challenged, even questioned, emerging technologies are redrawing the boundaries of power, and traditional assum
creator: Anna Majuri
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)

title: Eoin McNamara earns doctorate in political science
content:
FIIA researcher Eoin Micheál McNamara defended his PhD dissertation in political science at the Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies, University of Tartu on 9 May 2025. McNamara’s dissertation is entitled “The Risk Society’s Stabilization Failure? An Analysis of NATO and the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) in Afghanistan” and focuses on the Global War on Terror, specifically NATO’s state-building failure in Afghanistan after the 9/11 attacks.


The dissertation theorizes NATO’s security perceptions through the risk society concept initially proposed by German social theorist Ulrich Beck to capture social characteristics in later modernity. These characteristics can be particularly acute, contradictory and problematic in Western societies, affecting poli
creator: Anna Majuri
sourceTitle: The Finnish Institute of International Affairs (FIIA)
